segments.text: I see a woman standing at the sink, completely absorbed in her task of drying a plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her dress and apron make her look quite domestic, but there's a certain blissful ignorance on her face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the water overflowing the sink, cascading down the cabinet doors.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a mess that could easily turn into a disaster if she doesn’t pay attention.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, however, seem to be having a field day behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is precariously perched on a stool, reaching for that cookie jar.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but worry about him; that stool looks like it could tip any moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands there eagerly, waiting for her share with her hand raised.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s all so innocent, yet so risky at the same time.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the woman will ever notice the puddle forming at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR
